Journal.Title: The veterinary clinics of North America. Exotic animal practice
Journal.ISOAbbreviation: Vet Clin North Am Exot Anim Pract

Article.ArticleTitle: Heart Disease in Pet Birds - Diagnostic Options.

AbstractText: Cardiovascular diseases are common in pet birds. Diagnosis is often made postmortem only. In any case, suspicious for cardiac disease, a full diagnostic work up should be applied. First indications are given by the anamnestic data. Relative predisposition to cardiovascular diseases is associated with the species, breed, age, gender, lifestyle, and diet. Clinical signs and examination can reveal further indications of cardiovascular diseases, but may be unspecific or even without any pathologic finding. Diagnostic imaging, at least radiography, and echocardiography are always recommended. Advanced imaging methods, especially angiocardiography, can be valuable but is also more invasive and expensive.
